Artificial Intelligence.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a field of computer science focused on creating systems that can perform tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as learning, reasoning, and problem-solving.
AI is categorized into Narrow AI (designed for specific tasks), General AI (human-like intelligence), and Super AI (beyond human intelligence, currently theoretical).
AI is used in healthcare, finance, autonomous vehicles, robotics, and many other domains to automate and optimize processes.
AI employs techniques like machine learning, expert systems, natural language processing, and computer vision to simulate human intelligence.
The future of AI includes advancements in general intelligence, ethical AI, job automation, and integration into daily life across various industries.

Data Science.summary: Data Science is an interdisciplinary field that combines statistics, computer science, and domain knowledge to extract insights and knowledge from data.
The lifecycle includes data collection, data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, model building, deployment, and monitoring.
Popular tools include Python, R, SQL, Jupyter Notebooks, and libraries like Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, and TensorFlow.
A data scientist analyzes complex data, builds models, visualizes results, and provides actionable insights to support decision-making.
Used in fraud detection, recommendation systems, marketing analytics, healthcare predictions, and customer segmentation.

Machine Language.summary: Machine Learning (ML) is a subset of AI that enables computers to learn from data and make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed.
Supervised learning (training with labeled data), unsupervised learning (finding patterns in unlabeled data), and reinforcement learning (learning via rewards and penalties).
Common ML algorithms include Linear Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), and Neural Networks.
Metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score, and ROC-AUC are used to evaluate ML model performance.
ML is applied in recommendation engines, email filtering, fraud detection, predictive analytics, and speech recognition.
